org.aavso.tools.vstar.util.stats
Class DescStats

java.lang.Object
  org.aavso.tools.vstar.util.stats.DescStats

public class DescStats
extends java.lang.Object

Descriptive statistics functions for observations. For a series of mean observational data to make sense, it should only include a single band (or highly related bands such as Johnson V and Visual), so the data collections passed to the functions below should be chosen accordingly. Discrepant observations are ignored in all calculations.

Method Detail

calcMagMeanInRange

public static double[] calcMagMeanInRange(java.util.List<ValidObservation> observations,
                                          ITimeElementEntity timeElementEntity,
                                          int minIndex,
                                          int maxIndex)
Calculates the means of a sequence of magnitudes and time elements for observations in a specified inclusive range.

Parameters:
observations - A valid observation.
timeElementEntity - A time element source for observations.
minIndex - The first observation index in the inclusive range.
maxIndex - The last observation index in the inclusive range.
Returns:
The means of magnitudes and time elements in the range as a 2-element double array.

calcMagSampleStdDevInRange

public static double calcMagSampleStdDevInRange(java.util.List<ValidObservation> observations,
                                                ITimeElementEntity timeElementEntity,
                                                int minIndex,
                                                int maxIndex)
Deprecated. Only used in tests.

Calculates the standard deviation of a sample of magnitudes for observations in a specified inclusive range. We use the sample standard deviation formula as per http://www.aavso.org/education/vsa/Chapter10.pdf. See also a discussion of this here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_deviation

Parameters:
observations - The observations to which binning will be applied.
timeElementEntity - A time element source for observations.
minIndex - The first observation index in the inclusive range.
maxIndex - The last observation index in the inclusive range.
Returns:
The sample standard deviation of the magnitudes in the range.

createMeanObservationForRange

public static Bin createMeanObservationForRange(java.util.List<ValidObservation> observations,
                                                ITimeElementEntity timeElementEntity,
                                                int minIndex,
                                                int maxIndex)
Calculates the mean magnitude and the Standard Error of the Average for a sample of magnitudes for observations in a specified inclusive range. We use the sample standard deviation formula as per http://www.aavso.org/education/vsa/Chapter10.pdf. See also a discussion of this here: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Standard_deviation

Parameters:
observations - A list of valid observations.
timeElementEntity - A time element source for observations.
minIndex - The first observation index in the inclusive range.
maxIndex - The last observation index in the inclusive range.
Returns:
A Bin object containing magnitude bin data and a ValidObservation instance whose time parameter (JD or phase) is the mean of the indexed observations, and whose magnitude captures the mean of magnitude values in that range, and the Standard Error of the Average for that mean magnitude value. The binned magnitude data can be used for further analysis such as ANOVA.

createLeftToRightBinnedObservations

public static java.util.List<ValidObservation> createLeftToRightBinnedObservations(java.util.List<ValidObservation> observations,
                                                                                   ITimeElementEntity timeElementEntity,
                                                                                   double timeElementsInBin)
Deprecated. Use createSymmetricBinnedObservations() in preference.

Create a sequence of observations based upon bin size. The observations represent mean magnitudes at the mid-point of each bin. Each bin consists of the range index..index+binSize-1 Observation bins are populated from left to right of the time domain.

Parameters:
observations - The observations to which binning will be applied.
timeElementEntity - A time element source for observations.
timeElementsInBin - The bin size in number of time elements (days, phase increments) or portions thereof.
Returns:
An observation sequence consisting of magnitude means per bin and the observation at the center point of each bin.

createSymmetricBinnedObservations

public static BinningResult createSymmetricBinnedObservations(java.util.List<ValidObservation> observations,
                                                              ITimeElementEntity timeElementEntity,
                                                              double timeElementsInBin)
Create a sequence of observations based upon bin size. The observations represent mean magnitudes at the mid-point of each bin. Each bin consists of the range index..index+binSize-1 Observation bins are populated from center to left, then from center to right of the time domain.

Parameters:
observations - The observations to which binning will be applied.
timeElementEntity - A time element source for observations.
timeElementsInBin - The bin size in number of time elements (days, phase increments) or portions thereof.
Returns:
An observation sequence consisting of magnitude means per bin and the observation at the center point of each bin. If there were insufficient observations, the empty list is returned.

createLeftmostBinnedObservations

protected static void createLeftmostBinnedObservations(java.util.List<ValidObservation> observations,
                                                       int startIndex,
                                                       ITimeElementEntity timeElementEntity,
                                                       double timeElementsInBin,
                                                       java.util.List<ValidObservation> binnedObs,
                                                       java.util.List<double[]> bins)
Create a sequence of observations based upon bin size. The observations represent mean magnitudes at the mid-point of each bin. Each bin consists of the range index..index+binSize-1 Observation bins are populated only from the left-most region of the supplied list, starting at the specified index.

Parameters:
obs - The observations to which binning will be applied.
startIndex - The starting index in the list.
timeElementEntity - A time element source for observations.
timeElementsInBin - The bin size in number of time elements (days, phase increments) or portions thereof.
binnedObs - An observation sequence consisting of magnitude means per bin and the observation at the center point of each bin.
bins - A list of binned data (magnitude) arrays.

createRightmostBinnedObservations

protected static void createRightmostBinnedObservations(java.util.List<ValidObservation> observations,
                                                        int startIndex,
                                                        ITimeElementEntity timeElementEntity,
                                                        double timeElementsInBin,
                                                        java.util.List<ValidObservation> binnedObs,
                                                        java.util.List<double[]> bins)
Create a sequence of observations based upon bin size. The observations represent mean magnitudes at the mid-point of each bin. Each bin consists of the range index..index+binSize-1 Observation bins are populated only from the right-most region of the supplied list, starting at the specified index.

Parameters:
obs - The observations to which binning will be applied.
startIndex - The starting index in the list.
timeElementEntity - A time element source for observations.
timeElementsInBin - The bin size in number of time elements (days, phase increments) or portions thereof.
binnedObs - An observation sequence consisting of magnitude means per bin and the observation at the center point of each bin.
bins - A list of binned data (magnitude) arrays.
